description:
Add a test executable to allow verifying which minidump flag configurations work on which OSen.

BUG=32441
TEST=none


Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=38238

messages.text:
LGTM++

http://codereview.chromium.org/578003/diff/1/2
File chrome_frame/crash_reporting/minidump_test.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/578003/diff/1/2#newcode209
chrome_frame/crash_reporting/minidump_test.cc:209: const uint8* address = reinterpret_cast<const uint8*>(addr_in);
Perhaps uintptr_t instead of uint8* (here and below) to avoid hassles with overflow with signed pointer arithmetic.

http://codereview.chromium.org/578003/diff/1/2#newcode219
chrome_frame/crash_reporting/minidump_test.cc:219: if (address < range_end && address >= range_start &&
(address < range_end) seems superfluous having (address + sizeof(StructureType) < range_end)

thanks.

http://codereview.chromium.org/578003/diff/1/2
File chrome_frame/crash_reporting/minidump_test.cc (right):

On 2010/02/04 19:35:21, stoyan wrote:
> Perhaps uintptr_t instead of uint8* (here and below) to avoid hassles with
> overflow with signed pointer arithmetic.

Done.

http://codereview.chromium.org/578003/diff/1/2#newcode219
chrome_frame/crash_reporting/minidump_test.cc:219: if (address < range_end && address >= range_start &&
On 2010/02/04 19:35:21, stoyan wrote:
> (address < range_end) seems superfluous having (address + sizeof(StructureType)
> < range_end)

Done.
